# GitHub Actions Badges

Add these badges to your README.md to show build status:

## Build Status Badge

```markdown
![Build Status](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App/workflows/Build%20and%20Release%20Executables/badge.svg)
```

Replace `YOUR_USERNAME` with your actual GitHub username.

## Release Badge

```markdown
![GitHub release (latest by date)](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App)
```

## Download Count Badge

```markdown
![GitHub all releases](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App/total)
```

## Combined Example for README.md

Add this at the top of your README.md:

```markdown
# Computer-Peripheral-App

![Build Status](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App/workflows/Build%20and%20Release%20Executables/badge.svg)
![GitHub release (latest by date)](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App)
![GitHub all releases](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/YOUR_USERNAME/Computer-Peripheral-App/total)

Turn your Android device into a wireless mouse and keyboard for your PC!
```

The badges will show:
- ‚úÖ Build passing/failing status (green/red)
- üì¶ Latest release version
- ‚¨áÔ∏è Total download count across all releases

These update automatically after each build!
